fields.value: National Medical Expenditure Survey, 1987:  Household Survey, Long-Term Care Supplement [Public Use Tape 10]

authorName.value: United States Department of Health and Human Services. Agency for Health Care Policy and Research

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Health and Human Services. Agency for Health Care Policy and Research

dsDescriptionValue.value: The Long-Term Care (LTC) Supplement contains data on the functional status of persons responding to Rounds 1 and 4 of the Household Survey of the 1987 National Medical Expenditure Survey (NMES). The series of questions on functional status includes items on Activities of Daily Living (ADL) and instrumental ADL (IADL), continence, and use of special equipment. For those persons having at least one ADL or IADL difficulty, questions were asked about use of community services such as adult day care, senior centers, home-delivered and congregate meals, special transportation, and telephone assurance. Information was also sought on prior nursing home stays, and financial help from someone outside of the household. The Demographics and Sampling Weights file contains person-level data for individuals who responded for their entire period of NMES eligibility (Rounds 1, 2, 3, and 4). Each record contains person identifiers, selected characteristics including age, sex, race/ethnicity, and census region, dates of interview, a response-per-round indicator for the LTC Supplements, imputation flags for ADL/IADL, and sampling weight variables. The LTC Supplement population represented in File 2 is a subset of persons in File 1. File 2 is composed of separate records for LTC data collected during Round 1 (N=33,971) and during Round 4 (N=33,986).

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR IX. Health Care and Health Facilities
NACDA VI. Health Care Needs, Utilization, and Financing for Older Adults

fields.value: Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: File CB9675.ALL.PDF was removed from any previous datasets and flagged as a study-level file, so that it will accompany all downloads.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL with SAS Control Cards;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: The demographic data in File 1 replace corresponding data items previously released in the NATIONAL MEDICAL EXPENDITURE SURVEY, 1987: HOUSEHOLD SURVEY I, POPULATION AND HOME HEALTH PROVIDERS (ICPSR 9339).;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: The data in File 2 replace LTC items previously released inthe aforementioned study.;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Both weighted and unweighted frequencies are provided in the codebook. The File 1 unweighted age distribution at first interview was 0-17 years (N=9,915), 18-54 years (N=16,059), 55-64 years (N=3,031), and 65+ years (N=5,454). The race/ethnic distribution was white (N=24,589), Black (N=7,519), Asian/Pacific (N=510), Hispanic (N = 3,703), and other (N=1,841).;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: The data include dashes, decimal points, and blank characters.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: The civilian, noninstitutionalized population of the United States.

fields.value: The Household Survey is a national probability sample of   about 17,500 households in the national multistage area samples of   Westat and NORC, with oversamples of population segments known to be at   risk of needing or using services for chronic impairments or long-term   illness, in particular the elderly, the functionally impaired, poor and  low-income families, and Black and Hispanic minorities.
